title: Three charged spheres on an axis

content.question: Three spheres carry charges <math alttext="q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="q sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and are located at the positions shown on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis above. The electric potential energy between <math alttext="q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="q sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions is correct for the electric potential energy of the three-sphere system?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
